DEFAULT.description: The primary color used on the background of the app.

muted.description: The alternative background color used for the app background.

DEFAULT.description: The main color for used on surfaces, such as Cards or Side Panels.
The alternative background color used on surfaces that sit on top of some other UI elements.

strong.description: The strong background color used on surfaces.

stronger.description: The stronger color used on surfaces.

strongest.description: The strongest background color used on surfaces.

DEFAULT.description: The DEFAULT text color, such as Body Text.

hint.description: The strong color used on backgrounds meant to contrast against a parent background.

strong.description: The strong text color, such as Headings.

stronger.description: The stronger text color, such as Headings on muted backgrounds.

inverse.description: The color used on text to contrast against backgrounds.

brand.description: The branded text color, used in Links.

critical.description: The critical text color, mean to imply danger.

DEFAULT.description: The DEFAULT color used on icons.

disabled.description: The disabled color used on icons.

strong.description: The strong color used on icons.

inverse.description: The color used on icons to contrast against backgrounds.

critical.description: The critical icon color, meant to imply danger.

caution.description: The caution icon color, meant to imply a warning.

positive.description: The positive icon color, meant to imply success.

DEFAULT.description: The DEFAULT foreground color, shared between all foreground elements

disabled.description: The disabled foreground color, shared between all foreground elements

hint.description: The hint foreground color, shared between all foreground elements.

strong.description: The strong foreground color, shared between all foreground elements

stronger.description: The stronger foreground color, shared between all foreground elements

inverse.description: The color used on foregrounds sitting on top of a dark background, shared between all foreground elements

critical.description: The critical text color, mean to imply danger.

caution.description: The caution border color, mean to imply a warning.

critical.description: The critical border color, mean to imply danger.

container.description: The border color used on containers, such as Cards or Side Panels

hr.description: The border color used on dividers that separate sections or elements from one another

strong.description: The strong color used on backgrounds meant to contrast against a parent background.

stronger.description: The strong color used on backgrounds meant to contrast against a parent background.

inverse.description: The strong color used on backgrounds meant to contrast against a parent background.

DEFAULT.description: The primary background color used to inform success.

disabled.description: The disabled background color used to inform success.

strong.description: The strong background color used to inform success.

stronger.description: The stronger background color used to inform success.

inverse.description: The foreground color used to inform success.

DEFAULT.description: The DEFAULT background color used to indicate a warning.

disabled.description: The disabled background color used to indicate a warning.

strong.description: The strong background color used to indicate a warning.

stronger.description: The stronger background color used to indicate a warning.

inverse.description: The foreground color used to indicate a warning.

disabled.description: The disabled background color used to indicate danger, such as an error.

DEFAULT.description: The DEFAULT background color used to indicate danger, such as an error.

strong.description: The strong background color used to indicate danger, such as an error.

stronger.description: The stronger background color used to indicate danger, such as an error.

inverse.description: The foreground color used to indicate danger, such as an error.

DEFAULT.description: The DEFAULT background color used to contrast against the app or surface background.

strong.description: The strong background color used to contrast against the app or surface background.

inverse.description: The forground color of contrast backgrounds.

faint.description: Constants do not apply semantic meaning to the color.

strong.description: Constants do not apply semantic meaning to the color.

faint.description: Constants do not apply semantic meaning to the color.

strong.description: Constants do not apply semantic meaning to the color.

faint.description: Constants do not apply semantic meaning to the color.

strong.description: Constants do not apply semantic meaning to the color.

faint.description: Constants do not apply semantic meaning to the color.

strong.description: Constants do not apply semantic meaning to the color.

faint.description: Constants do not apply semantic meaning to the color.

strong.description: Constants do not apply semantic meaning to the color.

white.description: Constants do not apply semantic meaning to the color.

black.description: Constants do not apply semantic meaning to the color.

DEFAULT.description: The color used for the shadows in Depth.

shadow-1.description: Color used in the first Depth shadow

shadow-2.description: Color used in second Depth shadow

overlay.description: Color used for overlay backgrounds, such as the Modal or Bottom Sheet scrim.

translucent.description: Color used on overlay elements, such as Tooltip.
